summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on the arms embargo on Libya, including 1970 (2011) and subsequent resolutions, and reaffirming resolution 2656 (2022), decides to extend the authorizations set out in resolution 2635 (2022) for 12 months. The Secretary-General is requested to report on implementation within six and 11 months. The Council remains actively seized of the matter.
